[CURSOR:#4] Find results for text: `configure` in `https://symfony.com/doc/current/scheduler.html` (https://symfony.com/doc/current/scheduler.html/find?pattern=configure)
**viewing lines [0 - 16] of 16**

L0: # 【0†match at L264】
L1: A `RecurringMessage` is a message associated with a trigger, which configures 
L2: the frequency of the message. Symfony provides different types of triggers:
L3: 
L4: CronExpressionTrigger
L5: 
L6: # 【1†match at L396】
L7: These triggers allows to configure the frequency using different data types 
L8: (`string`, `integer`, `DateInterval`). They also support the relative 
L9: formats defined by PHP datetime functions:
L10: 
L11: 
L12: # 【2†match at L461】
L13: Custom triggers allow to configure any frequency dynamically. They are created 
L14: as services that implement TriggerInterface.
L15: 
L16: For example, if you want to send customer reports daily except for holiday
